section.title: Notation and Conventions
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC2119.
Domain name examples use RFC2606.

section.title: Gadget
section.t: A web-based software component based on HTML, CSS and JavaScript. It allows developers to write modularized, reusable web applications that work anywhere on the web without modification.

section.title: Container
section.t: A context into which a gadget is embedded into. This is typically an HTML page, served by an arbitrary web-service, viewable by a browser.

section.title: Overview
section.t: Common container is a lightweight gadget-and-container framework, based on JavaScript and server-driven end-point. Its mission is to simplify container and gadget integration model. It allows container developers to easily transform their page into a gadget-compliant container that can properly embed gadgets rendered by a gadget service. It does not address container-specific business-logic and layout.

section.title: Compliance
section.t: To be a gadget-compliant container, a container MUST be able to satisfy requirements defined in this section.

section.title: Lightweight
section.t: The framework is installed in a container page by a script tag, with its source pointing to the common container JS. This also provides a near-zero barrier to entry for new container clients.

section.title: Gadget navigation
section.t: The framework lives in the container page to provide API to container developers to navigate/open and close gadgets on the page, in a way that ensures opened gadgets continue to work, until they are closed.

section.title: Track latency
section.t: The framework allows container developers to track the latency times required to do a gadget navigation. This involves starting a timer when a gadget navigation is requested and stopping the timer when a gadget is fully rendered. Latency times can be broadcasted to the container for container-specific consumption.

section.title: Promote coherent changes
section.t: Changes in a gadget render may require simultaneous change on the container implementation. This framework will allow new container changes to be picked up at the same time when a gadget render service is updated, avoiding version-skew. Additionally, it will also promote all common- container-enabled pages to become updated at the same time.

section.title: Overview
section.t: When a gadget renders in a container it goes through several stages from the time it is added to the time it is eventually removed from the container. Some or all of these stages may occur for each gadget in the container. We refer to the different stages a gadget goes through as it is rendered in the container lifecycle events.

texttable.c: The container MUST call this lifecycle listener before a gadget is preload. If multiple gadgets are preloaded at the same time the container should call this listener once for the set of gadgets that are being preloaded. The listener function will be passed an array of gadget URLs.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener after a gadget is preload. If multiple gadgets are preloaded at the same time the container should call this listener once for the set of gadgets that were preloaded. The listener function will be passed a preload response object.
The container MUST call this lifecycle listener before a gadget is navigated to in the container. The listener function will be passed the URL of the gadget being navigated.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener after a gadget is navigated to in the container. This listener may be called before the gadget has finished rendering in the container. See osapi.container.CallbackType.ON_RENDER. The listener function will be passed the gadget site.
The container MUST call this lifecycle listener before a gadget is closed in the container. The listener function will be passed the gadget site.
The container MUST call this lifecycle listener after a gadget is closed in the container. The listener function will be passed the gadget site.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener before a gadget is unloaded from the container. If multiple gadgets are unloaded at the same time this listener will be called one time for each gadget that is unloaded. The listener function will be passed the gadget URL of the gadget being unloaded.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener after a gadget is unloaded from the container. If multiple gadgets are unloaded at the same time this listener will be called one time for each gadget that is unloaded. The listener function will be passed the gadget URL of the gadget being unloaded.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener before a gadget has rendered. This would typically occur during gadget navigation. The listener function will be passed the gadget URL of the gadget being renderd.

The container MUST call this lifecycle listener after a gadget has rendered. The listener function will be passed the gadget URL of the gadget being renderd. This does not necessarily mean that all the UI of the gadget has finished rendering but that the gadget has finished loading everthing it needs render. This listener may or may not be called after osapi.container.CallbackType.ON_NAVIGATED.

section.title: Example
Overview
section.t: Containers often need information about the gadget they are going to render, either before or after the rendering occurs. In the terms of the container this infomation is typically referred to as the gadget's metadata and MAY contain information such as the gadget's title, the features the gadget uses, and the views a gadget has. The container can use information such as the gadget title in the chrome around the gadget when it renders.

section.title: Usage
section.t:
Obtaining gadget metadata can be done before or after a gadget has rendered. To obtain a single gadget's metadata before a gadget is rendered a container can call
osapi.container.Container.preloadGadget. To obtain metadata for multiple gadgets at the same time before any of them are rendered a container can all osapi.container.Container.preloadGadget. A container can also recieve a gadget's metadata after rendering a gadget. The callback passed to navigateGadget takes one parameter which is the gadget metadata for the gadget that was renderd.

Since a gadget's metadata is unlikely to change very often containers SHOULD cache a gadget's metadata in order to avoid making the same request each time the gadget is rendered. Containers SHOULD purge a gadget's metadata when osapi.container.Container.unloadGadget or
osapi.container.Container.unloadGadgets is called.

section.title: Configuring The Container
section.t: Configuring common container is done at instantiation, by passing a bag-style JSON, with keys defined under osapi.container.ContainerConfig. All of these are optional.
These affect all rendering, unless overridden by Render Configuration.

texttable.c: Equivalent to the String allowDefaultView. Allow gadgets to render in an unspecified view. Default is true.
Equivalent to the String renderDebug. Indicates whether debug mode is turned on. Default is false.

Equivalent to the String renderDebugParam. The name of the query parameter to look for in the container's URL that indicates whether to put the container in debug mode. If this config parameter is passed and the query parameter is present in the container URL the container MUST honor its value over the osapi.container.ContainerConfig.RENDER_DEBUG config parameter.
Equivalent to the String renderTest. Indicates whether test mode is turned on. Default is false.

section.t: The following parameters do not effect rendering in the container.

texttable.c: Equivalent to the String GET_LANGUAGE. A callback function that will return the correct language locale part to use when asking the server to render a gadget or when asking the server for 1 or more gadget's metadata. The callback function should return a string equal to the language locale part.

Equivalent to the String GET_COUNTRY. A callback function that will return the correct country locale part to use when asking the server to render a gadget or when asking the server for 1 or more gadget's metadata. The callback function should return a String equal to the country locale part.

Equivalent to the String GET_PREFERENCES. A function that will asynchronously fetch the preferences to use when asking the server to render a gadget or when asking the server for gadget metadata. Discussion It will be passed the following parameters:
Name Type Description siteId string Gadget Site ID gadgetUrl string Gadget Url callback function(Map<String, Object> preferences) An asynchronous callback that will receive the value of the fetched preferences, if any. The GET_PREFERENCES function passed in the config should call this callback function with a Map that is constructed just like the Map for USER_PREFS Discussion

Equivalent to the String SET_PREFERENCES. A callback function that will persist the preferences. It will be passed the following parameters:
Name Type Description siteId string Gadget Site ID gadgetUrl string Gadget Url preferences object Preferences to persist. The format supplied here will be the same as is required for USER_PREFS.

section.title: Render Configuration
section.t: The following constants my be passed in a bag-style JSON object to functions in the container which render gadgets and URLs.

texttable.c: Equivalent to the String allowDefaultView. Allow gadgets to render an unspecified view. The default is true.
Equivalent to the String debug. Indicates whether to turn on debugging mode. The default is false.
Equivalent to the String height. The starting site height (in pixels). The default is 200.
Equivalent to the String nocache. Indicates whether to disable cache. The default is false.
Equivalent to the String testmode. Indicates whether to enable test mode. The default is false.

Equivalent to the String userPrefs. The gadget user prefs to render with. If undefined, and GET_PREFERENCES has been provided when configuring the container, the container should use GET_PREFERENCES to obtain preferences. The value of USER_PREFS should be a Map of preferences keys (Strings) to preference values (String or Array).
Equivalent to the String view. The view of the gadget to render.
Equivalent to the String width. The starting site width (in pixels). The default is 320.

section.title: osapi.container.Container.actions
section.t: The actions feature, as described in the gadgets.actions overview, allows gadgets to contribute actions to various parts of a container's user interface. The container can then render the actions consistently in context menus or action areas associated with particular data types, in global contribution areas (ie. navigation links at the top), or as part of the action areas of each gadget's chrome (ie. gadget's dropdown menu).

section.title: Method Details
section.t: The container can access actions either by retrieving an action from the registry based on a specified identifier, or retrieving all actions by data type or path specification, via the four getter functions below: getAction(), getAllAction(), getActionsByType(), and getActionsByPath(). In addition, the container must register a show actions function in order to render the actions in its UI, as well as a hide actions function to remove the actions from its UI when a contributing gadget has been unloaded. The container must register a navigate gadget handler to render and navigate to the gadget upon action execution if the gadget has not yet been rendered.

Optional parameter, the view target that indicates where to open the embedded experience. For example, tab, dialog or modaldialog.
opt_coordinates Object
Object containing the desired absolute positioning css parameters (top|bottom|left|right) with appropriate values.
Container implementations SHOULD honor optionally specified coordinates for the FLOAT viewTarget. Containers MAY honor coordinates for any other target they choose.
parentSite osapi.container.GadgetSite
The site of the gadget opening the embedded experience
opt_callback Function
If the container needs to asynchronously create the element for the embedded experience to render in this function MUST call the callback parameter with the element and return undefined. If the element can be created synchronously than the container MUST just return that element as the return value from this function.
